profileAlternative.name: Alex Theedom
profileAlternative.headline: Principal Technical Instructor at MuleSoft
profileAlternative.summary:
I am a senior MuleSoft training instructor, Java Champion, Jakarta EE Committee member, Java developer/architect and trainer with well over 10 years’ experience developing Java Enterprise Edition and Spring Framework applications in a variety of sectors including finance, gambling and e-learning.

I am the author of "Java EE 8: Only what’s new" a straight-to-the-point book covering only what’s new in Java EE 8 and the co-author of "Professional Java EE Design Patterns" which discusses enterprise design patterns and architecture.

I regular speaker at conferences and have presented at JavaOne San Francisco, Devoxx UK, jDay Sweden, Java Day Lviv, Kiev and Belarus, VoxxedDay Istanbul, and JEEConf Kiev and I am a member of the Oracle Technology Network Speaker Bureau.

I share my passion for Java through my blog readlearncode.com and by publishing articles on IBM DeveloperWorks, DZone and JavaCodeGeeks.

I am also a technical editor/reviewer for Packt Publishing and an Oracle Certified Professional in Java SE and Java EE.

I was the vice-chairman and mentor of an after-school coders club, jerseycoders.com and a member of the Jersey Digital Users Committee and I was on the panel launch of the Eclipse MicroProfile initiative at JavaOne 2016, representing the London Java Community (LJC).

positions.title: MuleSoft
positions.description: On top of my responsibilities as Technical Instructor, I am the first Train The Trainer instructor in EMEA. I work with other instructors in EMEA through workshops and feedback to keep improving skills and customer satisfaction scores. I work closely with the Marketing & Ops teams to define and execute strategies that drive participants in the instructor lead training classes to successfully become certified.

given.text:
Alex has been a mentor at our teenage coding club, Jersey Coders, for approx two years. During this time he has been an enthusiastic and inspiring influence for the children and a valuable driving force on the mentoring team. Not only does he put in the time to teach the kids, but he has taken on additional roles, updating the website and social media channels, putting together the curriculum for the Java group and most recently working to develop a badge system to reward and recognise achievements. I can thoroughly recommend Alex for his infectious enthusiasm in this voluntary role, as well as his professionalism in everything he does.

Alex is pro-active and very focused on his tasks. He enjoys learning new technologies and is capable of doing it very quick. He has great technical skills mainly in Java platform. Ultimately, he is an easygoing person and helps to build a good teamwork environment.

Alex is a meticulous professional, responsible and motivated, he is proactive and always curious and does not cease in his learning. He is smart and clever, with a need to face new challenges. I have always found him an affable person, always near and not hesitant in helping colleagues in need. Very analytical and methodical in his approach to problem solving. Highly recommendable.
